title: Joeyp
author: Joeyp
content: Nowadays, there are a lot of malware/antiviruses trying to steal your crypto from wallets, see Atomic wallet being compromised thread here - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5454994.0, or just steal, lock your data.  So please share which Windows software you use daily and especially antivirus, antimalware for wallet safety.I use CCleaner software for computer cleaning together with CCEnchancer, which improve CCleaner cleaning.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMNowadays, there are a lot of malware/antiviruses trying to steal your crypto from wallets, see Atomic wallet being compromised thread here<...> How did you connect malware and viruses to the Atomic wallet incident?Quote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMSo please share which Windows software you use daily and especially antivirus, antimalware for wallet safety.Linux!  Quote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMI use CCleaner software for computer cleaning together with CCEnchancer, which improve CCleaner cleaning.CCleaner is useful for system optimization and maintenance that removes junk files from your PC. It doesn't work as an antivirus or antimalware tool, so it won't improve your wallet's security at all.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well I like to make sure my system is always the most protected. And that is why I will be running at all times AVG Internet Security 2023. And for extra security I run a these programs ever single day on my system. They are free to use and are called Eusing, Spybot, and Ccleaer. https://download.cnet.com/Eusing-Free-Registry-Cleaner/3000-2094_4-10521691.htmlhttps://download.cnet.com/Spybot-Search-Destroy-Portable/3000-8022_4-75331484.htmlhttps://www.ccleaner.com/

comments.author: Joeyp
comments.body: Quote from: decodx on September 10, 2023, 09:31:23 PMQuote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMNowadays, there are a lot of malware/antiviruses trying to steal your crypto from wallets, see Atomic wallet being compromised thread here<...> How did you connect malware and viruses to the Atomic wallet incident?Quote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMSo please share which Windows software you use daily and especially antivirus, antimalware for wallet safety.Linux!  Quote from: Joeyp on September 10, 2023, 12:41:57 PMI use CCleaner software for computer cleaning together with CCEnchancer, which improve CCleaner cleaning.CCleaner is useful for system optimization and maintenance that removes junk files from your PC. It doesn't work as an antivirus or antimalware tool, so it won't improve your wallet's security at all.By removing junk files, CCleaner + CCEnchancer can also clean viruses and malware.

comments.author: Joeyp
comments.body: Quote from: mich on September 11, 2023, 07:27:18 AMWell I like to make sure my system is always the most protected. And that is why I will be running at all times AVG Internet Security 2023. And for extra security I run a these programs ever single day on my system. They are free to use and are called Eusing, Spybot, and Ccleaer. https://download.cnet.com/Eusing-Free-Registry-Cleaner/3000-2094_4-10521691.htmlhttps://download.cnet.com/Spybot-Search-Destroy-Portable/3000-8022_4-75331484.htmlhttps://www.ccleaner.com/Did this Spybot - Search And Destroy free version find something yet - malware etc. ?

comments.author: Iron Fist
comments.body: The best free antivirus programs are:1. BitDefender Free2. Kaspersky Free3. Avast/AVGToday, with almost everyone using Windows 10/11, one of these free antivirus programs is entirely sufficient for your everyday PC activities.Also, add an AdGuard or uBlock Origin extension to your browser and configure them with the filters. Don't forget to adjust your browser's security settings and block third-party cookies while checking the "Do Not Track" option!But, no antivirus program will fully protect you if you are a risk-taker, downloading various things from torrents, visiting suspicious or adult websites, etc. In such cases, use your common sense, regular backups are highly recommended, and do not keep important things on the same computer. Also, avoid clicking on links in emails from unknown senders as that's how most people get infected.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Quote from: Joeyp on September 11, 2023, 10:56:10 AMQuote from: mich on September 11, 2023, 07:27:18 AMWell I like to make sure my system is always the most protected. And that is why I will be running at all times AVG Internet Security 2023. And for extra security I run a these programs ever single day on my system. They are free to use and are called Eusing, Spybot, and Ccleaer. https://download.cnet.com/Eusing-Free-Registry-Cleaner/3000-2094_4-10521691.htmlhttps://download.cnet.com/Spybot-Search-Destroy-Portable/3000-8022_4-75331484.htmlhttps://www.ccleaner.com/Did this Spybot - Search And Destroy free version find something yet - malware etc. ?  Well it does find files my computer does not need. The files are most just temporary files. Which I then deleted to speed up my scans.
